website_summaries.verdict: Offers both power and an impressive warranty for the price – it's the one to pick if you want to save money.
pros: Powerful little machine with 1250W power that can produce up to 100 lbs of ground grain per hour
Well-made construction that resists jamming and overheating
Comes with small grain and bean attachments
cons: Has the tendency to jerk, especially when grinding coarse items
Slower when it comes  to grinding larger grains and beans

customer_reviews.title: makes it easy to grind grains
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a four because it came defective, spewing flour all over the counter. I was going to return it, but before that I searched other sites for someone who had this problem. One person had this problem, and the manufacturer responded by sending another lid, which solved that problem. I didn't want to spend lots of time returning the grinder and waiting for a replacement, so I found a site that sold replacement parts and ordered a new lid. No more spewed flour and I'm really pleased. I think this grinder was a returned product that was sent out to unsuspecting me.
customer_reviews.author: careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mill, but it's a little tricky till you get use to it. I've had more flour on the counter and floor than in the container - more than once! When it first starts, it jumps! Fortunately, it didn't jump off the counter, but it did loosen the connection between mill and flour container - hence, flour on counter. Lots of flour on the counter and everything sitting on the counter. But it grinds those wheat berries in seconds! It's very fast - which is why I bought it. I can adjust to its jumping, but I could not adjust to the first mill I purchased which took forever to grind two cups of wheat.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Rayner Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out after 5 uses!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used my mill only 5 times and the motor blew out. Avoid this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of fake products
customer_reviews.text: I never got to use the machine because it arrived defective. The canister lid's connector hose was made of hard plastic that couldn't be straightened to connect to the machine. There was hard lime deposits in the machine hole where the flour comes out.
customer_reviews.author: tenpe

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to mill seeds, it broke down during the first use shortly after starting to use it. It will not turn on anymore no matter what I do. I will be returning this item and then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos G Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t happy with how it worked!
customer_reviews.text: I Used it it First off it smelt like was getting hot and struggling to grind my Eikorn wheat berries! So I am returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Got this on May 25th 2020. I only used this mill twice since I bought it. When I used it last in Julu 2020 I even shredded my chickpeas in food processor. It burnt all my flour, the house was filled with smoke, the metal peice was melting. This is just insanely bad product. Very disappointing. I wanted to return it but the return window has passed in Amazon. I had to ship it to the Wondermill for repair. And I had to pay almost $100 for shipping and handling and an adopter I was told to help this never happens.
customer_reviews.author: Etsepatos Zenebe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for legumes!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill. I exclusively grind legumes and I am floored how good this machine is. I just made garbanzo bean flour and the coarse setting gets me superfine flour. Obviously you can only feed 5-10 at a time into the machine, but I swear the flour is so much different than the one you can buy. Yesterday I made black bean flour and it came out beautifully. I am so happy I invested in this machine. Black bean flour is way too expensive. I use the 'Homemade Flour' book as inspiration, it is really fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Elke

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: I highly dislike the mechanics of the Electric Grain Mill Grinder, because it broke after one use.
customer_reviews.author: Bunga Manurung

customer_reviews.title: We've had ours for 15 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for me when my husband and I got married 15 years ago. Ours is still going strong. So when my sister got married two years ago, I bought her one of these too. She had been taking her wheat to my mom, who also bought one of these on our recommendation. It's loud, but it does a great job at grinding red and white winter wheat for us. If ours gives up ever, I'd be happy to buy one of these again, but of course I hope it just keeps going for years more.
customer_reviews.author: Trimama

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous machine
customer_reviews.text: Marvelous machine! I like everything about it. light weight , quiet, easy to set up and clean up (compared to my decades old stone mill)! I had to use my old mill outside because it was so messy. This mill I can store and use on the counter top! It is so easy and convenient, I can make flour(s) as needed. The reason for 4 stars in the cleaning category: I wish the transfer tube was detachable from the catch bin for cleaning. Any suggestions for cleaning it out?
customer_reviews.author: Mountain home

customer_reviews.title: flour smells like chemical
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed as the smell after the grain is milled is like chemical. I have used the organic hard wheat berries.
customer_reviews.author: kishorekumar Patnala

customer_reviews.title: Woah!
customer_reviews.text: This toy, excuse me, tool is so fun. Put in a grain and voila! Out comes flour. Works as advertised. Not disappointed at all. Have not used pastry or coarse setting yet, but the bread setting has worked well for cookies too. I will warn you that this item is large. The mill will not fit in my cabinets, but the flour bucket will. I use this quite often so I don’t mind having it out on the counter. Makes a good conversation starter....and then most people think i’m Nuts for milling my own flour. To each their own. Happy milling!
customer_reviews.author: Royal foil

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this mill twice now and I love it. The flour is ground up very fine, no large pieces of wheat berries in my flour. My bread comes out with such a nice texture. I love being able to have 100% whole wheat bread with a white bread texture. This bread tastes so much better than any whole wheat bread I have ever tasted. It is so much healthier as well as long as you grind your flour and bake your bread with it that same day.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, no disappointment here!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best mill we have ever owned. We grind flour(s) a few times a week and this mill is fast, efficient, and pretty quiet for a kitchen mill. I can grind 4 cups of wheat berries in about a minute. The consistency of the ground flour is excellent and resembles that of all purpose flour on the 2nd setting.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Excited to use, but arrived with some scratches?
customer_reviews.text: I'm excited to use this thing! I unpacked it and there are scratches on the white plastic of the actual mill, the cord prongs were bent so I couldn't plug it in, and when I fixed that and finally plugged it in, it scared me to death because the on switch was flipped. I'm wondering if I ended up with a refurbished model? Shouldn't have since I payed for a new one...will update after grinding some Flour.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckster

customer_reviews.title: Great for making tasty bread
customer_reviews.text: My mother finally convinced me that great bread requires freshly milled flour (apparently, whole wheat oxides after milling, so "whole wheat flour" is not the whole grain). I found this mill easy to set up and has, thus far, worked reliably for grinding wheat and rye. The resulting bread has been very tasty (and hopefully healthy as well). The mill is loud (I guess that's why they rebranded from "Whisper Mill"), but I've never seen a mill that wasn't. It appears well-made and supposedly has a high-end electric motor. It mills the 500g for my bread in less than 20 seconds. The only setting is the grain coarseness.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job of grinding. Three settings are more than sufficient, and it grinds grain to a uniform texture. On the "con" side, it is a little hard to use. It takes a bit of work to setup, and feeds slowly. It has a tendency to jamb with common grains.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Embee

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe how fast this mills the grain
customer_reviews.text: Having been a baker for a long time I finally decided to give milling my own flour a try. This unit is much faster than I could imagine. While it is loud when on, it is not much different than running a vacuum in the house. It took less then 3-4 mins to mill just under 2# of wheat berries into top notch flour. Now the adventure begins with experimenting all the different grain combinations.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pietrykowski

customer_reviews.title: Goes a wonderful job on hard white wheat berries and produces a ...
customer_reviews.text: Goes a wonderful job on hard white wheat berries and produces a nice fine flour. Noisy when running empty but not much louder than a vacuum cleaner. Super fast grinding grain into flour. Unit will spin around it not held when starting due to the high torque of the motor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great investment. It has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: We have used our WonderMill to grind our wheat for bread making for the last two years. This is a great investment. It has worked flawlessly. If you put it together correctly it does not get any flour dust on the counter. The sound is not louder than a vacuum cleaner and only loud when it is starting up before the grain is put into it. It will grind the grain in no time at all and makes perfect bread flour. It is easy to clean and well worth it. You have never tasted bread until you taste some made with fresh ground white grain whole wheat flour. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. It is easy to load, makes nice grinding product and it is not too noisy when compared to other mills that type. The transfer of flour and the cleaning is relatively painless and does not make too much or a mess in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: HubertusS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to just leave on counter for anytime use.
customer_reviews.text: My old wheat grinder was giving me problems. So I did a lot of research on line and came up with this grinder that is the best for the money. It works great and so much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosiebinkles

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I use this mill about twice a week and I absolutely love it. I make my own pasta and pizza dough and the Wondermill definitely delivers. After milling the grain I let it run for 5 seconds to make sure it is thoroughly cleaned. This mill has already paid for itself! One part spelt, one part hard white wheat and two parts hard red wheat makes an excellent all-purpose flour.
customer_reviews.author: Steven James Jorde

customer_reviews.title: Works great for grinding whole read wheat berries
customer_reviews.text: Works great for grinding whole read wheat berries. We've used this for several months to feed our large family and would highly recommend it. This is much quieter than our old K-tec which did fine but was so loud we had to use it outside - not fun during New England winters. This one is used right on our kitchen counter. It does not fling dusty flour at all, hardly any noticeable amount escapes. Having the separate flour holder is really great for storing extra flour. We just grind up a full batch and use as needed so we don't have to run it as often. Definitely worth the extra few dollars! We recommend it highly to everyone we know.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: A must have for all healthy bakers!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill!!!!! It's simple to use and does a great job! Pastry, bread, course grind, it does it all!!! I'm a retired Pastry chef and I highly recommend this mill over the other flour mills available.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fine mill
customer_reviews.text: This mill works quite well, but the setup is a bit awkward (mill blows flour into a canister which, if not attached just right, will end up with flour all over the kitchen). The flour comes out so fast that you can't really use anything but the canister the mill comes with to collect the flour. Aside from that, it works splendidly. The only problem I had was when I didn't notice the canister had filled up (canister is opaque, so I couldn't tell from the outside), and then the tube connecting the mill to the canister got packed. I had to use an air compressor to clean it out. But the flour it produces is great.
customer_reviews.author: sla26

customer_reviews.title: Great mill
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I absolutely love using to milk my flour. This way I know I am getting the safest product for my family to use for bread making. It is kind of loud especially if you don’t have the top on yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at the recommendation of a friend who used hers for a very long time before this. One thing my wife loves about this one is how fast it grinds the wheat. We have had other wheat grinds of various types, and this one costs more, but is well worth it. Our friend who has one of these, says she even uses this grinder for other grains such as Pop-corn for creating corn meal! We haven't used this one for that yet, but it is nice to know!
customer_reviews.author: JB101

customer_reviews.title: GO FOR IT
customer_reviews.text: First experience with milling grain. Very simple to use and easy to clean and store. Way faster than I had thought. Wondermill service department is fantastic to work with as well; I had a few questions and they were quick to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Over a year and works great
customer_reviews.text: I've been grinding wheat for bread (about 100lbs) and buckwheat (about 16 lbs) for pancakes with my WonderMill for over a year now. And, yup, like other reviewers have said, it sounds like a shop vac when it first starts up, but quiets right down when the grain is poured in the hopper. For the <2 minutes it takes to grind 2 qts of wheat berries, the sound level is no problem. The mill does a consistant grind and seems like it will last forever. If it dies, would I get another? Sure thing. Would I recommend the WonderMill to friends? With no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Buy a good soft brush to clean
customer_reviews.text: Grinds wheat very quickly and perfect flour in the bread setting which is why we bought it. Haven’t used it but a couple of times so the proof will be in the long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry godejohn

customer_reviews.title: It is great that I can make my own flour from different ...
customer_reviews.text: It is great that I can make my own flour from different kinds of beans and grains. It seems like it cannot take large bean size, I put soy bean in there and it didn't work for the last few beans, and I got nervous if it stuck in there...
customer_reviews.author: Zhijian Xi

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought the WonderMill. It performs exactly as described in the product information. It was delivered today and I tried it out after grinding 2cups of wheat and discarding as per instructions. Amazed at how fast it grinds. Also very happy with the quality of the fine grind for pastry. I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Great at home mill - for flour making!
customer_reviews.text: We are so glad we purchased this and have been using this mill for years, it works wonderfully! We make a full canister of flour at home every couple of weeks. We make our own flour to avoid cross contamination with allergens in store bought flours. It's a great reliable product, the customer service for WonderMill was great too! I would recommend this for anyone who wants to make their own flour from grain! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL MILL!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at so many different kinds of mills and their reviews. This one works perfectly and the price was right. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speedy machine
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with the speed of this thing. It is also so very quiet. I needed 12 cups for 6 loaves of bread and I did have to do two batches but it only took les than 5 minutes. With our old grinder it would have taken about an hour and a half. (Bread turned out great too🤗.)
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Excited about my WonderMill!
customer_reviews.text: I had a chance to taste some bread made of freshly ground flour. Since then I realized that I want to make my own flour. It is fresh, full of nutrients. I have to say that fresh flour makes superior foods to the store-bought version. This Wondermill is an expensive investment into our home nutrition but it is worth it for me. It is slightly noisy when you start it (and instructions demand to turn it on while it is still empty). The noise diminishes when grinding begins. The flour smells so nice and so fresh! Anyway, so far I like my mill.
customer_reviews.author: iLove Quality

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This thing is fast. Some reviews say it is extremely loud, but for what it is doing I don't think so. Maybe a little louder than a hair dryer. It makes very fine flour the first time through. It is well made and should last for years. I LOVE IT, and making homemade bread with fresh ground warm wheat flour is "yummmy". You have got to try it. If you don't have one, "GET ONE"!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russell G.

customer_reviews.title: Good durable machine
customer_reviews.text: It's a great machine. It grinds all the different type of berries I put into it. Fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: William Farrell

customer_reviews.title: WonderMill very quick on milling beans, rice and wheat !
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how the WonderMill machine operates, quicky delivered, very quick on milling beans and rice, and just as fine as store bought flours, just wonder if the inventor gave praise to the most High for knowledge building the patent but I doubt it, inventor prolly a heathen for the hardkill list, any way I give praise for the great tech Hope it last a long time, if not then the 5 stars goes to a negative -5 lol
customer_reviews.author: Obadiah Yedidya

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this to make homemade bread. Easy to use and quite running
customer_reviews.author: Woreo

customer_reviews.title: Loud, effective and expensive
customer_reviews.text: It works well and grinds just about anything to powder in seconds like I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: Great help for wheat-sensitive individuals
customer_reviews.text: I've used it twice now. It did a great job getting my rice flour even finer, so that I can bake for my wheat-sensitive daughter. Also ground brown rice from brown rice.
customer_reviews.author: der

customer_reviews.title: This is a very efficient grinder.  The fineness is superb
customer_reviews.text: We had been using stone mills but the motor went out. This is faster and less bulky. A little high pitch but not as loud as the stone mills we have had.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fink

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic grain mill!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC!!!! This mill really works great! Loud, yes. While it's grinding, it's pretty quiet, but when it's first turned on empty and after it's done grinding, this thing is loud! That said, this this mill is unbelievable and worth all the noise. No question about it.
customer_reviews.author: Yooper Salo

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Had a small issue when I first got it with it that was my fault. Called the company and they helped to rectify it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Jo

customer_reviews.text: That's good. If there's one thing I'm missing, it's too powdery. That's how well it is pulverized.
customer_reviews.author: smilestf

customer_reviews.title: Great wheat grinder. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love my wheat grinder. I have been looking for I've for many years. My sil recommended this one. It does everything I need it to do. It is so nice to grind fresh wheat and make homemade bread without all the additives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great power and really easy to keep it clean and the countertop
customer_reviews.text: Really fast and really neat with it's own connected bowl.
customer_reviews.author: MtnKathy

customer_reviews.title: The best flour mill!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is very simple to use and to clean. It does not make a mess compared to other products that leaves flour dust all around. I’m very happy and satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chultim Dolma

customer_reviews.title: Try before buying
customer_reviews.text: Torque on start-up jerks the machine away from canister. Noise is well beyond "quiet". Coarse grind is still very powdery. I wish I had tried it sooner so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This mill works as stated. I have only used it twice but it makes wonderful flour in a minimum of time. I did not have the problems with "flying flour" as others have had. Listen for the click when fastening the bucket to the mill.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: Love using this to grind my own flour! It is very easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Mulder

customer_reviews.title: We had been grinding grains with a hand grinder and we are all amazed at how quickly and efficiently the WonderMill grinds grain
customer_reviews.text: Wow! We had been grinding grains with a hand grinder and we are all amazed at how quickly and efficiently the WonderMill grinds grain! We're all super happy with the purchase and would recommend it to others. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mary KH

customer_reviews.title: Wonder"ful" Mill
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the mill two years ago and have been delighted with it's performance. Setup is quick and easy. The grinder produces a fine wheat flower in no time. The mill is clean and produces very little dust as long as you don't overfill the output container. Clean-up is a jiff. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to grind wheat with minimal time and trouble.
customer_reviews.author: D Anderton

customer_reviews.title: Could not ask for a better grinder
customer_reviews.text: If I could give more than 5 stars I would. I totally love this little grinder, been using for over a year with no problems whatsoever. It grinds soft or hard wheat with no issues whatsoever, only point is wear ear plugs, it is loud. August 2015 update. Still LOVE this grinder, zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my kitchen. Much quieter than grinding wheat in my Vitamix and it's much faster as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is great for small users
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised...maybe better. I don't grind a lot of grain but this guy makes short work of it when I do. Easy to clean and plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lid to the container, that holds the flower ...
customer_reviews.text: The lid to the container, that holds the flower, keeps popping off, while grinding the wheat, have lean on it to keep it down, so that we don't have flour everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grain be ground
customer_reviews.text: We love our mill. It does sound similar to a rocket ship when in use so consider hearing protection. The rice we ran through it for the initial cleanse and test literally turned to dust. If this can't grind it you should seek professional help.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use. Works GREAT for Tapioca and Rice.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this WonderMill mainly because of the cost of Gluten Free flours. I was THRILLED with how well it grinds rice and tapioca starch, which are my staple flours. Though the flours seem a little more course than those I have purchased it has not made ANY difference in my baking.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Good thing they don't call it a whispermill any more!
customer_reviews.text: It's not whisper-quiet, but we can run it after the children are asleep and it doesn't wake them. 100% whole wheat bread made from freshly-milled wheat berries in this mill is lighter in texture than 50% whole / 50% white made with store flour. There's no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: The mill arrived quickly. Packaging was good. We plugged it right in and started grinding wheat immediately. Easy to use. This is a powerful little work horse. It made short work of a 5 gallon bucket of wheat. We baked 4 loaves of bread the first day, and it was fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Very fast
customer_reviews.text: The wheat grinder is amazing. Very well built and grinds wheat very fast. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: This product and reviews do not match up!
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 of these and had to return both. Amazon, please look at all the inflated reviews. Most flimsy product. First once got stuck at the finest setting and then the dial would just keep on rotating on itself. Second one just jammed and when I looked closely, there was flour stuck in it. By no means I had over filled or what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This machine works great at grinding the wheat. It's very easy to use and clean. The lids and parts could connect a little easier which is the only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating. There's still room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea R.

customer_reviews.title: Loud, but you are grinding wheat, what do you expect?
customer_reviews.text: This is a LOUD machine, but it's also FAST so it's only loud for the few minutes it takes to get your product ground. I grind wheat in mine (hard white wheat usually) into flour for bread about once a week, I make 8-10 cups of flour at a time. The machine always works just like I need it to and the flour it makes produces stellar breads.
customer_reviews.author: K. Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. I've ground both hard red wheat and soft white wheat with perfect results. The unit is a bit louder than I anticipated but it's not totally overwhelming. Overall a very well made product that functions perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I own a Wonder Mill Deluxe manual mill but due to disability can longer use it so bought this electric model. I wouldn't call it Whisper - it sounds like my vacuum cleaner - but it takes only a minute or two to produce what took 30-45 minutes with the hand-operated mill. The 6-year warranty of the milling heads and a limited lifetime warranty on the rest of the machine are also attractive. It does heat the flour, but I don't think excessively so, and it doesn't have much variety of settings, but I don't need them. I've used this mill now for a few months and it meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: GBaybee

customer_reviews.title: excelllent
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my wonder mill. It is so fast at grinding wheat. Cleaning it is very easy. I am so glad that I was able to finally purchase one. I have been searching for a wheat grinder for a couple of years and finally found one that does the job very well. It is the world's best grain machine.
customer_reviews.author: milettem

customer_reviews.title: Very bad items
customer_reviews.text: Bad Very bad I will return it Because does not works
customer_reviews.author: Hamzarayes

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: It grinds wheat berries to the fondness U like for bread making. Loving this mill and use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect for grinding flour. quick, effecient and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: It makes good flour. I use it a lot
customer_reviews.text: It works well the way it is meant to. It makes good flour. I use it a lot. So far it hasn't given me any troubles.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: This mill works great, though I wish it can mill the grain ...
customer_reviews.text: This mill works great, though I wish it can mill the grain finer than this. It works pretty fast and i don't have to spend a lot of time on it. If you're going mill a flour, you better set it to the 'pastry' level, otherwise it's a bit grainy. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Rini Hnamte

customer_reviews.title: Not my Dad's Mill
customer_reviews.text: Someone complained about this being noisy. While noise does come from the thing, compared to the mill my father had/still has this little whisper mill is significantly more quiet. Then again, I'm comparing it to a model that is some 25 years old.
customer_reviews.author: K. Garfield

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a little noisier than I was hoping it would be. I just use ear plugs next time
customer_reviews.author: Rose E. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Wheat usage
customer_reviews.text: this mill is great for grinding wheat. We don't grind other grains. The flour is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: We were hopeful the WonderMill would do wonders with rice and it exceeded our expectations. It does an amazing job of grinding rice into flour for baking. And it's fast, very fast. We are a household of Celiacs(intolerant to wheat gluten) so it's really added value to our life in Ecuador as gluten free rice flour is not available. We've enjoyed tortillas, pizza and bagels in the last couple of weeks. I would highly recommend this product to anyone needing rice flour.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cohoon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Mill! Lives up to its name.
customer_reviews.text: I love this grain mill!. It is quick and easy to use. It's much quieter than the previous mill I had. I have to make sure the top lid snaps completely on the milled flour or it will come off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but box was damaged in shipping
customer_reviews.text: Package looked like it had been returned and then re-shipped to me. However the unit was fine and works great!
customer_reviews.author: BFK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mill
customer_reviews.text: This mill works great. I love being able to grind my own wheat to make bread. It does the job quickly and consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Poff

customer_reviews.title: Mill for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Your mill works on 110 V power supply and in Malaysia our voltage is 240V.I have plced an order for a step down transformer and I am getting this next week.Hope to do some good grinding after this.
customer_reviews.author: Willie MATHEWS. (Malaysia)

customer_reviews.title: Fast grinding, good flour
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make flour for bread. I bought it to replace a Wonder Mill which wore out after at least 15 years of frequent use. A very good product. Easy to use, fast grinding, makes good flour.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful grain mill. Very quiet and very fast. So glad I purchased this product!
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Not any kind of flour you'd want to bake bread with ...
customer_reviews.text: Even set to the finest setting, I can never get anything finer than coarse masa harina. Even running it through twice. If you want actual flour close to the consistency that one gets from cheap, generic all-purpose flour from the grocery store, this is not going to do it for you. Kinda cool that I can make flour at all, though. Just disappointed that it's not useful for most common applications.
customer_reviews.author: mattyd

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. I was using Vitamix to mill wheat ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. I was using Vitamix to mill wheat berries but this product is really very fast
customer_reviews.author: Nur

customer_reviews.title: Wondermill performs.
customer_reviews.text: We are milling hard winter wheat for whole wheat flour. Set the dial between pastry and bread and got a very smooth flour. Noise level was very tolerable. Flour yielded a light loaf of delicious bread.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Words just can't describe...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a powerhouse! You cannot go wrong with this purchase if you want to start grinding your own wheat (it tastes sooooo much better than already ground!!!)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. Kirbach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bread flour
customer_reviews.text: My wife saw this in action on YouTube so I purchased one to make bread flour. It’s very well built, simple to use and does a great job of milling wheat.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!! Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our family had to go gluten free! The idea of buying high priced GF flours the rest of my life did not seem cost efficient. I've been using my mill for different things and it works great. The sight willitgrind.com is also very useful. I am very thankful I found the Wondermill. It does everything they say it will!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: No problem getting through grains, beans, or corn- if you haven't tried fresh milled corn meal, MY WORD. Clean up is a breeze, just a let swipe of a pastry brush.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: great device
customer_reviews.text: i have been more than pleased with this mill, it grinds my wheat perfectly every time. I have used it 30+ times and have never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks amazon
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful and very powerful product I love this product thanks amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ravi dudhela

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: grinds my wheat berries very fast and makes wonderful flour!
customer_reviews.author: David Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love this Grain Mill~
customer_reviews.text: We have been pleased with the WonderMill Grain Mill. We like the different bread settings. It is easy to use and easy to clean. It is quieter than our last grain mill.
customer_reviews.author: shappy

customer_reviews.title: rating this item
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted. I have enjoyed this tremendously. I was completely impressed with the timing of getting my item. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: tracy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product works great. Really fast and dose what it says online.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: I love this mill
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill! Easy to use. I grind wheat every other day and it does wonderfully with corn also
customer_reviews.author: GaJen

product_meta.title: Powerful Electric Grain Mill Grinder for Home and Professional Use - High Speed Electric Flour Mill Grinder for Healthy Grains and Gluten-Free Flours - Electric Grain Grinder Mill by Wondermill
feature_bullets: FASTER THAN THE COMPETITORS IN ITS PRICE RANGE - This grain mill for flour is powered by a 1,250-watt LG Electronics motor that gives both capacity and longevity; an electric flour mill grinder that’s sturdy, fast-grinding and built to last

MADE TOUGH; HEAVY DUTY - An electric grain grinder that grinds over 100 lbs of flour in 1 hour without overloading; Unlike other flour mills, this flour grinder mill is also an electric wheat grinder, corn grinder, rice grinder or brewery grinder.

HIGHLY CERTIFIED; LIFETIME WARRANTY - Wondermill flour grinder mill complies with the most demanding quality and safety standards - UL (USA), CSA (Canada), and CE (the European Union). A limited lifetime warranty is included with each Wondermill purchased

QUIET, EASY AND DUST-FREE - With only 5 parts and no complicated settings or switches; An easy-clean cyclo-canister and filtration tube catches all ground flour without the big mess while its quiet operation lets you mill peacefully without all the noise

NO OVERHEATING; HEALTHIER CHOICE - This electric flour mill can work up to 10 hours without overheating; Preserves the quality nutrients of healthy food options & homemade bakery with its most powerful micronizing milling chamber and stainless steel fins
